cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northward, forecast to make landfall along the north-central Gulf Coast late Friday or early Saturday, then accelerate northeast across Alabama and Georgia toward the Carolinas before exiting into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the AL/FL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the AL/FL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border, then inland across MS, AL, GA and into the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible as the system’s remnants pass nearby Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impacts expected for the South Carolina coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 4–6 inches possible Sunday into early Monday with localized flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible inland as the system tracks across the Southeast.
